ok...stupid question. how do I get the inflatable hab model cfg-10 to inflate once in orbit? what is actually required for this to work?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, RaiderMan said:
> 
> 
> ok...stupid question. how do I get the inflatable hab model cfg-10 to inflate once in orbit? what is actually required for this to work?
> 

The right click at the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> shows that they require X tons “rocket parts” to inflate. This represents the fact that an empty tube is not very useful, and the interior partitions and fixtures need to be added for it to be useful.

so send up a tank with a docking port that has <abbr title="Reaction Control System">rcs</abbr>, and “configure containers” to add rocket parts. Dock, then inflate. If the number of parts is less than the total needed, it partially fills it, then you can bring more. 

**Edited <time datetime="2017-12-02T21:19:09Z" title="12/02/2017 09:19  PM" data-short="6 yr">December 2, 2017</time> by tater**
suggested tank to use for a quick, dirty 'just want it done yesterday' inflation?

Depends on the cfg part.

a tank the size of the biggest COS hab holds ~11 tons of parts, fwiw.
cfg-10. what tank should I send up to inflate it. I need a tank specifically for this part.

Clearly you can read, since we’re writing to each other.

Right click that part in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">vab</abbr>, it will tell you how many tons of parts. When you configure containers, it shows the number of units of parts, and the mass.
ok...I'm clearly not reading right. how do I do this? I have never used this part before.

Right click the part in the part menu. That’s where parts show what they include, or things like engine Isp.

Config containers is in right clicking a tank.

I’ll write up a description with screenshot images for the SSTU wiki and add it to the station core wiki tonight.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-12-02T20:29:32Z" title="12/02/2017 08:29  PM" data-short="6 yr">December 2, 2017</time> by tater**

should I be configuring the hab itself or a separate part...I'm not following you.  

treat me like a complete novice with this part please and give it to me step by step.

You are checking the CFG part via the part menu right click. It might even be in the description.

You only need to configure the tank part of you want a tank with some fuel and some parts. If you attach the parts tank to something that can move, then just select rocket parts as the fuel.

I’m on my phone, right now.

step by step please sir.  

as in what do I install, what do I click....since I cannot seem to make it work.  

AKA proper instructions.  

looping me around is doing nothing but severely annoying me and making me disinclined to use this part.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-12-02T20:38:02Z" title="12/02/2017 08:38  PM" data-short="6 yr">December 2, 2017</time> by RaiderMan**

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, RaiderMan said:
> 
> 
> step by step please sir.  
>   
> 
> as in what do I install, what do I click....since I cannot seem to make it work.  
>   
> 
> AKA proper instructions.  
>   
> 
> looping me around is doing nothing but severely annoying me and making me disinclined to use this part.
> 

1.) Right click on the HAB or CFG part.  It will tell you how many tons of resources you need.

2.) Pull out an MFT tank from the editor parts list.

3.)  RIght click on the tank.

4.)  Select 'configure containers'.

5.) Edit the contents of the container.  Put a '1' in the text box next to 'RocketParts'.  Put a '0' in any other boxes that already had a number in them.

6.) Resize the fuel tank until the container-GUi tells you you have enough tons worth of rocket parts.

7.) Launch the fuel tank, dock it with the HAB/CFG.

8.) right click on the HAB/CFG part.  Press 'inflate'.  If you had enough rocket-parts, it will inflate.   If you didn't, it will consume what you brought, and await more.  It keeps track of what was consumed, so you can launch multiple smaller shipments if you want.

this....THIS is EXACTLY what I needed. thank you sir.

..never mind. just figured that out XD
